TestDescription.name: Reflected file download
TestDescription.Description: Reflected file download is a new web attack vector that enables attackers to initiate a fake download from a trusted domain. The file to be downloaded doesn't exist on the target domain, it is dynamically generated by exploiting this vulnerability. Consult web references for more information about this vulnerability.
TestDescription.Impact: An attacker can potentially gain complete control over a victim's machine if the victim executes the downloaded batch file.
TestDescription.Recommendation:
To fix this issue the web application must return a Content-Disposition header with a [bold]filename[/bold] attribute. Setting the filename attribute fixes the name of the downloaded file and the browser doesn't have to guess it.
For example: [pre] Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=1.txt [/pre]

Reference.database: Reflected File Download - A New Web Attack Vector
